unit_learning_outcomes.description: analyse discipline-specific creative, managerial, production and communication skills.
work effectively in collaborative creative teams from initial concept to realisation.
apply concepts, theories and frameworks across management and event production in the creation of an event.

assessments.description: Groups apply knowledge to create a comprehensive management and production plan to organise an event from concept to hypothetical realisation. Students work on individual plans discussing their role in an event management team in relation to the group project. Refer to iLearn for further information.
Students analyse and evaluate concepts, theories, and frameworks in an industry case study. Refer to iLearn for further information.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit provides students with applied knowledge in the area of performance and event management in the performing arts and entertainment industries including talent management, marketing, social media strategies, event planning, production, publishing and distribution in both live events and the growing area of online arts and entertainment. This unit will develop your management skills in a broad range of contexts across performance and event management in the performing arts and entertainment industries including corporate and online events. No prior experience of the performing arts and entertainment industries is required.
data.title: Performance and Event Production

title: Performance and Event Production
